meanings.definition: Move (the king) two squares toward a rook on the player's first rank and then moving the rook to the square over which the king crossed.
meanings.sent1: During the game, players can castle to protect their king and reposition the rook.
meanings.sent2: In chess, castling is a strategic move to safeguard the king and connect the rooks.
meanings.sent3: The king and rook decided to castle together, creating a fortress on the board.
meanings.sent4: She castled her king swiftly, like a skilled general securing his stronghold.
meanings.sent5: The act of castling can change the dynamics of the game in an instant.

meanings.definition: The act of moving the king in this way.
meanings.sent1: After the castling, the king found safety behind the rook.
meanings.sent2: His quick castling surprised his opponent and improved his position.
meanings.sent3: The castling of the king brought a sense of security to the player.
meanings.sent4: The castling maneuver was like a protective shield around the king.
meanings.sent5: The importance of castling became evident as the game progressed.
